quiz.text: What is the basic difference between WPI and CPI as highlighted in the passage? Answer only in reference to the passage.
options: an upward surge in WPI reading is an inflationary pressure while the same heaved inflationary pressure is not in the case of CPI.
WPI is relevant from policy perspective while CPI regards only economy and business firms.
WPI fails to communicate actual burden borne by the end consumer while in CPI, the actual inflation affects the end consumer.
WPI takes into account price change of food and transportation while CPI takes into account the minerals and non-food articles.
None of these.

But by the same token, it can allow the public to directly punish businesses and business leaders for actions it disagrees with in a manner that simply wasn’t possible before.
Negative market sentiments claimed Uber co-founder Travis Kalanick’s scalp last year.

quiz.text: Which of the following sentences is not the part of the paragraph?

none of these

quiz.text: Find the ratio of the volume of a cylinder to that of a cone. Statement I: The radius of the cylinder and that of the cone are in the ratio 1 : 2. Statement II: The height of the cylinder is 21 cm and the height of the cone is 7 cm less than that of the cylinder. Statement III: The sum of their heights is 35 cm.
options: Both statements II and III are required to answer the question
Both statements I and II are required to answer the question
Both statements I and III are required to answer the question
All these three statements are not sufficient to answer
Any two of the three statements are sufficient to answer

quiz.text: Which of the following sentences is not the part of the paragraph?
options: As the Lok Sabha debates the vote of no confidence, representatives of farmers from across the country will be marching outside Parliament under the banner of All India Kisan Sangharsh Coordination Committee (AIKSCC), an umbrella body of 201 farmer organisations.
Farmers have already passed a vote of no confidence against this government.
Far from helping the farmers, this government has actually harmed them in their hour of crisis. This is a strong indictment, backed by solid evidence.

Further, the government has effectively bypassed this law in the land acquisitions done by central agencies like the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and has also allowed State governments to nullify the provisions benefitting the land-owning farmers.
None of these

quiz.text: What is the sum of the present ages of Suresh and Mahesh? Statement I: Mahesh is 7 years elder than Suresh Statement II: 6 years before the ratio of ages of Suresh and Mahesh is 4: 5 Statement III: Mahesh’s age after 10 years is 3 times half of the present age of Suresh.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statements II and III alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statements I and III alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement III alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statements I and II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
If data in either statements I and II together or data in statements I and III together are sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all statements I, II, and III together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Which of the following sentences is not the part of the paragraph?
options: Already they are present in the form of thermocol, dust and in some cases, they are now used in making fatty oils.

Government authorities have to understand the importance of the order of Plastic Ban in a nutshell – UP is the largest and the most populated state, plastic is in use in every corner of the state, even in the remotest area. It’s been in use for more than 30 years in different forms.

In winters, poor burn plastic to get some warmth. Gases which emit from this burning are poisonous and directly affect our lungs. In a nutshell, it is the most dangerous man-made material in this world.
This is the most dangerous aspect of it, because this oil goes directly to the consumer leading to health disaster in many ways.
None of these

quiz.text: Conclusions:     I.         Some dollars are rupees.       II.            At least some coins are notes. Statements:         I.            Only a few notes are coins. Some dollars are notes. Some coins are rupees.       II.            Only rupees are dollar. Some rupees are coins. No coin is notes.     III.            Only a few coins are notes. No notes are dollars. Some rupees are dollars.
options: Only statement II follows
Only statement III follows
Both statements I and II follow
Either statement I or II follows
Both statements I and III follow

quiz.text: Which of the following is the answer?
options: While a three judge Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India, Justice Dipak Mishra, did not formally reject the stand the Centre has been taking that law and order was a state subject, it asked what it was doing to curb the increasing menace, and even told the Additional Solicitor General to "take instructions" and respond to a plea that invoke the provisions of Article 256 of the Constitution and issue the requisite directive to the states.

The Centre told the Additional Solicitor General to "take instructions" and respond to a plea that invoke the provisions of Article 256 of the Constitution and issue the requisite directive to the states and asked to curb the increasing menace as it always believed that law and order was a state subject whereas a three judge Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India, Justice Dipak Mishra, did not formally reject the stand the Centre has been taking.

A three judge Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India, Justice Dipak Mishra, did not formally reject the stand the Centre has been taking on law and order as a state subject rather it asked what it was doing for curbing the increasing menace and told the Additional Solicitor General to "take instructions" and respond to a plea that invokes the provisions of Article 256 of the Constitution and issue the requisite directive to the states.

Although the Centre always believed that law and order was a state subject, a three judge Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India, Justice Dipak Mishra, did not formally reject the stand the Centre has been taking to curb the increasing menace and asked the Additional Solicitor General to "take instructions" and respond to a plea that invokes the provisions of Article 256 of the Constitution and issues the requisite directive to the states.
None of the above is correct.

quiz.text:
Which of the following explains the meaning of the given phrase?

(I)With the grand ceremony of the 8-km roadshow in Gujarat is over, it is the time to look out for future prospects to address some of the issues in order to facilitate a better relationship between India and Japan, even as the two leaders and militaries share stronger ties.

(II)As the luxuriant ceremony and display of 8-km roadshow in Gujarat is over, the time has come to discuss the most relevant facts and address some of the issues to assist closer ties between India and Japan, even though the two leaders and militaries form closer bonds.

(III)After the splendid display of 8-km roadshow in Gujarat, the two leaders are in the process of diplomatic meeting to facilitate closer ties between India and Japan despite sharing closer bonds.
options: Only (I) is correct
Only (II) is correct
Both (I) and (II) are correct
Both (II) and (III) are correct
All are correct

quiz.text: Statements: Famine is looming in Somalia as the country reels from its worst drought in four decades. This has resulted in unprecedented levels of hunger and displaced nearly 1 million people inside the country since last January. Some 45,000 Somalis have arrived in Dadaab, Kenya in 2022 and more are expected to arrive in the coming months, but resources to receive them are stretched.   Course of Action:     I.         In order to fulfill the immediate need of water for various activities, the Somali government should invest heavily in desalination projects of converting saline water into fresh water.       II.            Kenya should offer permanent citizenship to those immigrants who are bringing either high educational qualification with them or wealth of any form. Rest of the immigrants should be steered off to the borders of other countries.
options: Only I follows
Only II follows
Both I and II follow
Either I or II follows
Neither I nor II follows

options: Only I follows

quiz.text: Statements: Women in India have to stitch together various short commutes to fulfill the many responsibilities they have which according to the World Bank is recognized as the “trip chaining” and this increases travel costs. Women in India often also make decisions to use certain kinds of more expensive routes or forms of transport on account of them being perceived to be safer. These factors amount together as a “pink tax” that specifically burden women and impede them from making optimal decisions for themselves. Conclusions:        I.            Pink tax which is not favored by masses is levied by concerned states to improve social infrastructure catering to the feminine voters.      II.            A platform targeting all women commuters is required in order to suggest jobs closer to the user’s residence. This in effect will definitely cut their travel cost.
options: Only conclusion I follows
Only conclusion II follows
Both conclusions I and II follows
Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows

C. Cities having million plus population are mandated to take up PPP projects worth minimum of 25% of their total project fund allocation.
options: A only
B only
C only
A and C
B and C

quiz.text: Statements: The continuing rise in concentrations of the main heat-trapping gases, including the record acceleration in methane levels, shows that we are heading in the wrong direction. There are cost-effective strategies available to tackle methane emissions, especially from the fossil fuel sector, and we should implement these without delay. However, methane has a relatively short lifetime of less than 10 years and so its impact on climate is reversible. As the top and most urgent priority, we have to slash carbon dioxide emissions which are the main driver of climate change and associated extreme weather, and which will affect climate for thousands of years through polar ice loss, ocean warming and sea level rise.   Inference:     I.     If we can control the carbon dioxide emissions through a cost effective method then we can ignore the Methane levels as it has a relatively short lifetime of less than 10 years.   II.     Unlike Methane, Carbon Dioxide has a longer lifetime and we still do not have cost-effective strategies to tackle its emissions.
options: Only I is inferred
Only II is inferred
Both I and II are inferred
Neither I nor II is inferred
Either I or II is inferred

Conversely, France and the United States show almost gender parity: 20% and 26% of girls respectively report having been harassed in these two countries, with comparable proportions among boys. Course of Action:        I.            Countries having lesser reports of bullying amongst girls should create effective and trustworthy channels for reporting such cases.      II.            Countries having lesser reports of bullying amongst girls should implement stricter regulations to curb such incidents amongst boys and also create trustworthy channels for reporting such cases.
